Column Comment.0: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.1: ANALYSIS SOURCE: The source that the analysis came from, this could be a labtechnician, a lab, a company, a government agency, etc.
Column Comment.2: REMARK SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number that can keep track of theremarks made in the analysis. This can help to keep track of the events that occurredand what was said about them.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first comes into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row is no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.7: PPDM COLUMN NAME: The name of a column that has an association with thislevel of classification system.
Column Comment.8: PPDM GUID: This value may be used to provide a global unique identifier for this rowof data. If used, optional PPDM NOT NULL constraints should be created.
Column Comment.9: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.10: PPDM TABLE NAME: The name of a table that has an association with this level of aclassification system. This may be used in conjunction with an appropriate foreignkey from the table that is referenced, or may be used generically in combination withthe
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: REMARK BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the business associate to whom the remark isattributed.
Column Comment.13: REMARK TYPE: The type of remark that may be made regarding the analysis. Thismay be a very generic remark such as the outcome of the sample analysis or anyproblems that may have arisen to any equipment during the sample analysis, etc.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the preparation and processing of the sample. This column is asufficient method to keep track of what is done in the sample analysis. However, ifthe requirement for more complicated tracking such as two steps occurringsimultaneously or if steps are needed to be added to the initial procedure, use thetwo columns STEP_SEQ_NO1 and STEP_SEQ_NO2 in the tableANL_STEP_XREF.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
